intro: Bupleurum mayeri, commonly known as Mayer's angelica, is a herbaceous perennial plant native to Central Asia. It belongs to the family Apiaceae, which includes many aromatic herbs and vegetables. The plant features finely divided, fern-like leaves and produces small, yellowish-green flowers in umbels. It thrives in well-drained soils and prefers full sun to partial shade. Bupleurum mayeri is often cultivated for its ornamental value and has been used in traditional medicine for its purported health benefits.
